## ENSO Status:

The Climate Prediction Center defines El Niño conditions as existing when a one-month positive sea surface temperature anomaly of 0.5C or greater is observed in the Niño-3.4 region of the equatorial Pacific Ocean, an expectation that the 3-month Oceanic Niño Index (ONI) threshold will be met (see graphs below), and an atmospheric response typically associated with El Niño is observed over the equatorial Pacific Ocean. Please visit the [Climate Prediction Center website](https://www.cpc.ncep.noaa.gov/products/analysis_monitoring/enso_advisory/ensodisc.shtml) for El Niño status and predictions.

![](images/elnino34region.png)

![](images/ONI.png)

<script>
document.addEventListener("DOMContentLoaded", () => {
  const slides = [
    { src: "images/imgSst.png",  title: "Sea Surface Temperature (SST) Map", caption: "The NOAA 1/4° daily Optimum Interpolation Sea Surface Temperature data (http://www.ncdc.noaa.gov/oisst)." },
    { src: "images/imgAnom.png", title: "SST Anomaly Map", caption: "The NOAA 1/4° daily Optimum Interpolation Sea Surface Temperature data (http://www.ncdc.noaa.gov/oisst). The climatology used to compute the anomalies is from a 1971–2000 base period." },
    { src: "images/imgAnomTSn.png", title: "SST Anomaly Time Series - Northern California", caption: "The Sea Surface Temperature Anomaly time series off of the California Coast west of Humboldt Bay. The climatology used to compute the anomalies is from a 1971–2000 base period." },
    { src: "images/imgAnomTSc.png", title: "SST Anomaly Time Series - Central California", caption: "The Sea Surface Temperature Anomaly time series off of the California Coast west of Monterey Bay. The climatology used to compute the anomalies is from a 1971–2000 base period." },
    { src: "images/imgAnomTSs.png", title: "SST Anomaly Time Series - Southern California", caption: "The Sea Surface Temperature Anomaly time series off of the California Coast west of the Southern California Bight." },
    { src: "images/imgSstTSn.png", title: "SST Time Series - Northern California", caption: "The Sea Surface Temperature time series off of the California Coast west of Humboldt Bay. The climatology used to compute the anomalies is from a 1971–2000 base period." },
    { src: "images/imgSstTSc.png", title: "SST Time Series - Central California", caption: "The Sea Surface Temperature time series off of the California Coast west of Monterey Bay. The climatology used to compute the anomalies is from a 1971–2000 base period." },
    { src: "images/imgEk.png", title: "Ekman Upwelling Map", caption: "The wind-driven vertical movement of water." },
    { src: "images/imgCurl.png", title: "Wind Curl Map", caption: "Wind curl or torque: the tendency of wind stress to cause rotation or its ability to supply relative vorticity to the ocean." },
    { src: "images/imgChl.png",  title: "Chlorophyll Concentration Map", caption: "Chlorophyll concentration from the VIIRS sensor." }
  ];

  let index = 0;

  const imgEl = document.getElementById("map-image");
  const titleEl = document.getElementById("map-title");  // now updates <span>
  const captionEl = document.getElementById("map-caption");
  const prevLink = document.querySelector(".map-slider .prev");
  const nextLink = document.querySelector(".map-slider .next");

  function updateSlide() {
    imgEl.src = slides[index].src;
    titleEl.textContent = slides[index].title;
    captionEl.textContent = slides[index].caption;

    prevLink.style.opacity = index === 0 ? 0.5 : 1;
    nextLink.style.opacity = index === slides.length - 1 ? 0.5 : 1;
  }

  prevLink.addEventListener("click", (e) => {
    e.preventDefault();
    if (index > 0) {
      index--;
      updateSlide();
    }
  });

  nextLink.addEventListener("click", (e) => {
    e.preventDefault();
    if (index < slides.length - 1) {
      index++;
      updateSlide();
    }
  });

  updateSlide();
});
</script>
